## This is Test

For all $x$, $y \in \mathbb{R}$, $\vert x - y \vert \leq \vert x \vert + \vert y \vert$.


Indeed, since $z \leq \vert z \vert$ for every $z \in \mathbb{z}$

\begin{align}
x + y &\leq \vert x \vert + y \leq \vert x \vert + \vert y \vert \\
-(x+y) &\leq \vert x \vert - y \leq \vert x \vert + \vert y \vert
\end{align}
